alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Greene; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 5:57PM EDT until May 06 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN FAYETTE OH COUNTY IN CENTRAL OHIO, NORTHEASTERN CLINTON AND NORTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO... At 557 PM EDT, radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Although the heaviest rain has ended, additional rainfall over the next hour or two may worsen ongoing flooding or high water in the area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Washington Court House, Sabina, Staunton, Good Hope, Frankfort, Clarksburg, Bowersville, Port William, Jasper Mills, Rock Mills, Reesville, Bloomington, Melvin, Plano, Paintersville, Austin, Interstate 71 at US Route 68, Lumberton and Middleton Corner. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
